body_html:
The variable that is used in cuda_configure.bzl starts with an underscore so that would be _TF_CUDNN_VERSION.
…
On Sat, Jun 3, 2017, 7:29 AM gunan ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** requested changes on this pull request. ------------------------------ In configure <#10307 (comment)> : > @@ -522,6 +522,12 @@ while true; do CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH="" done +# Set default CUDA version if not set +if [ -z "$TF_CUDA_VERSION" ]; then + TF_CUDA_VERSION="8.0" + export TF_CUDA_VERSION I think I know what is going on. Simply exporting it wont help. You need the value written to bazelrc, with this command: write_action_env_to_bazelrc "TF_CUDA_VERSION" "$TF_CUDA_VERSION" However, you need to make sure that we do not have two conflicting values are not written, so it may complicate things a little. ------------------------------ In configure <#10307 (comment)> : > @@ -626,6 +632,12 @@ while true; do CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH="" done +# Set default CUDNN version if not set +if [ -z "$TF_CUDNN_VERSION" ]; then same as above, this has to be written to bazelrc. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#10307 (review)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADjHf2LUHFmgomPx05q3q5rC6BeB8ilQks5sAO9WgaJpZM4Nq--O> .
body_text:
The variable that is used in cuda_configure.bzl starts with an underscore
so that would be _TF_CUDNN_VERSION.
…
On Sat, Jun 3, 2017, 7:29 AM gunan ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** requested changes on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In configure
 <#10307 (comment)>
 :

 > @@ -522,6 +522,12 @@ while true; do
    CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH=""
  done

 +# Set default CUDA version if not set
 +if [ -z "$TF_CUDA_VERSION" ]; then
 +  TF_CUDA_VERSION="8.0"
 +  export TF_CUDA_VERSION

 I think I know what is going on.
 Simply exporting it wont help. You need the value written to bazelrc, with
 this command:
 write_action_env_to_bazelrc "TF_CUDA_VERSION" "$TF_CUDA_VERSION"
 However, you need to make sure that we do not have two conflicting values
 are not written, so it may complicate things a little.
 ------------------------------

 In configure
 <#10307 (comment)>
 :

 > @@ -626,6 +632,12 @@ while true; do
    CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH=""
  done

 +# Set default CUDNN version if not set
 +if [ -z "$TF_CUDNN_VERSION" ]; then

 same as above, this has to be written to bazelrc.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#10307 (review)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADjHf2LUHFmgomPx05q3q5rC6BeB8ilQks5sAO9WgaJpZM4Nq--O>
 .
body:
The variable that is used in cuda_configure.bzl starts with an underscore
so that would be _TF_CUDNN_VERSION.

On Sat, Jun 3, 2017, 7:29 AM gunan <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@gunan* requested changes on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In configure
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/10307#discussion_r119979902>
> :
>
> > @@ -522,6 +522,12 @@ while true; do
>    CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH=""
>  done
>
> +# Set default CUDA version if not set
> +if [ -z "$TF_CUDA_VERSION" ]; then
> +  TF_CUDA_VERSION="8.0"
> +  export TF_CUDA_VERSION
>
> I think I know what is going on.
> Simply exporting it wont help. You need the value written to bazelrc, with
> this command:
> write_action_env_to_bazelrc "TF_CUDA_VERSION" "$TF_CUDA_VERSION"
> However, you need to make sure that we do not have two conflicting values
> are not written, so it may complicate things a little.
> ------------------------------
>
> In configure
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/10307#discussion_r119979905>
> :
>
> > @@ -626,6 +632,12 @@ while true; do
>    CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH=""
>  done
>
> +# Set default CUDNN version if not set
> +if [ -z "$TF_CUDNN_VERSION" ]; then
>
> same as above, this has to be written to bazelrc.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/10307#pullrequestreview-41913693>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADjHf2LUHFmgomPx05q3q5rC6BeB8ilQks5sAO9WgaJpZM4Nq--O>
> .
>
